My absolutely favorite.

comment.body:
That is the matter of the so called "Facebook" generation.
At every time we have had deep webs/darknets and many people used them. Take a look at the old Usenet, then Freenet, Tor and I2P.
The dirty clearnet is lost for us and be controlled by the big brothers like Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Apple etc..
But we have the choise, better the duty, to use the free deep webs and to reduce the produced data in the clearnet, so that these data gatherers have not so much to collect.
There is much space beyond the clearnet.

comment.body: I am new at ZeroVoat and do not know that. Perhaps an advanced user can help you.
comment.body_p: I am new at ZeroVoat and do not know that. Perhaps an advanced user can help you.

comment.body:
If you have never installed Arch Linux, I recommended to use Manjaro. It is Arch Linux with a well done graphical installer.
Arch Linux itself has no real installer. You have to follow the installation instruction and to install the system step by step. But it is easy to do.
BTW, Arch Linux is rolling release, so an version upgrade is not needed at any time.
comment.body_p: If you have never installed Arch Linux, I recommended to use Manjaro. It is Arch Linux with a well done graphical installer.Arch Linux itself has no real installer. You have to follow the installation instruction and to install the system step by step. But it is easy to do.BTW, Arch Linux is rolling release, so an version upgrade is not needed at any time.

comment.body: For normal zites you can put them into your favorites in ZeroHallo. There are then always on top of all zites.
comment.body_p: For normal zites you can put them into your favorites in ZeroHallo. There are then always on top of all zites.

comment.body:
I spoke about the advantages of Linux often with my friends and workmates. Over years.
Result: All are using Windows today. :-|
One big point for Windows is really the motivation of the people. They all work with Windows in their offices, universities or schools and they use what they know at home - Windows.
The movement would perhaps grow, if Linux would be used more often in these institutions or in some bigger private companies.
comment.body_p: I spoke about the advantages of Linux often with my friends and workmates. Over years.Result: All are using Windows today. :-|One big point for Windows is really the motivation of the people. They all work with Windows in their offices, universities or schools and they use what they know at home - Windows.The movement would perhaps grow, if Linux would be used more often in these institutions or in some bigger private companies.

topic.title: Be active and make use of ZeroVoat
topic.body:
I like Reddit very much. Here at ZeroVoat we have a similar platform to discuss (and even vote for the "good" content). I don't know, why so less users are here.

I read topics at ZeroTalk or ZeroMe where users ask for more content to read. I wish that some of them, and or course other users as well, come to this place and talk to each other.

ZeroNet is growing and we can build a good base for more new stuff here.
topic.body_p: I like Reddit very much. Here at ZeroVoat we have a similar platform to discuss (and even vote for the "good" content). I don't know, why so less users are here.I read topics at ZeroTalk or ZeroMe where users ask for more content to read. I wish that some of them, and or course other users as well, come to this place and talk to each other. ZeroNet is growing and we can build a good base for more new stuff here.

topic.title: An article for all Windows users
topic.body:
You reached the ZeroNet and did the first step into the right direction to leave the dirty clearnet. ZeroNet is not a darknet, but it is nor far away from it. ;-)

Here you use a pseudonym and does not be controlled from anybody like Google etc. But! You are using Microsoft. It is not Open Source nor free software (Free as in freedom). Microsoft is gathering tons of data from you with every use of any Windows, especially Window 8 or 10. To do the next right step you should install Linux on your machine. A regular Linux does not talk to other servers itself and and no data is gathered from any company. Linux makes the use of a computer much more private and secure.

There are many Live-Systems on DVD or USB-Stick , which can just be downloaded. With such a system you boot a live Linux and can test it on your computer without being afraid to destroy something. A very popular one and similar to Windows in its handling is Linux Mint (external link: https://linuxmint.com/). If you like it, you can even install it right now nearby your Windows. It automatically installs Linux Mint without destroying Windows and with every boot you can decide, which one to use. So you can play games on Windows and do all other important things on Linux.

Linux Mint plays all your music or videos, handles all you pictures and has software for every purpose on board.

You can use Linux Mint for free all day and perhaps you will someday delete your Windows, after you saw all the advantages of Linux. I use Windows only at work (I have to). At home I use only Linux for more then 15 years now. My first installation, Suse Linux, was 1998. :-)

Try it and test it as much as you like. You cannot do a mistake. Later, as an advanced user, you can change to another (not better) Linux which works perhaps better for your particular purpose.

topic.title: Puppy Linux - Always fast and always with you
topic.body:
In my blog I published a short introduction to Puppy Linux:
Tusiko's Tavern

It is easy to use, very fast and runs from a stick.
